API Documentation¶

class ax12driver.AX12(id, baudrate=115200)¶

AX12 emulates a physical AX12 servomotor

__init__(id, baudrate=115200)¶

Constructs a new ‘AX12’ object and instanciates I2C_bus if needed

Parameters:
  • id – The id of the AX12, must be between 0 and 255
  • baudrate – The baudrate to communicate with the AX12, defaults to 115200
Returns:

Returns nothing
classmethod scan_i2c(print_on_fly=None, baudrate=None)¶

Lists AX12 connected to the raspberry

Returns:A list of the id of the connected raspberry
ping()¶

Pings the AX12

Returns:0 if the ping succeeded, a negative error value else
get_status()¶

Checks the status of the AX12

Returns:0 if everything is fine, a negative value in case of an error
get_position()¶

Gets the current position of the AX12

Returns:The position in degree from -150 to 150 increasing clockwise
get_speed()¶

Gets the current speed of the AX12, may be inaccurate

Returns:The speed in %, a positive value means a clockwise speed
get_load()¶

Gets the current load of the AX12, may be inaccurate

Returns:The load in %, a positive value means a clockwise load
get_voltage()¶

Gets the current voltage of the AX12

Returns:The voltage in Volts
get_temperature()¶

Gets the current temperature of the AX12

Returns:The temperature in Celcius degrees
is_moving()¶

Checks if the AX12 is moving

Returns:1 if the AX12 is moving, 0 otherwise
set_mode(mode)¶

Sets the mode of the AX12

Parameters:mode – 0 for default mode, 1 for wheel mode
Returns:0 in case of success, raises an exception otherwise
set_speed(speed)¶

Sets the speed of the AX12

Parameters:speed – A percentage, positive for a clockwise speed
Returns:0 in case of success, raises an exception otherwise
set_torque(torque)¶

Sets the torque limit of the AX12

Parameters:torque – A percentage, if 0 the AX12 won’t be able to move
Returns:0 in case of success, raises an exception otherwise
set_LED(state)¶

Sets the LED state of the AX12

Parameters:state – 1 to put the LED on, 0 to put the LED off
Returns:0 in case of success, raises an exception otherwise
move(position, callback=<function <lambda>>)¶

Orders the AX12 to move to a specified position

Parameters:
  • position – A position in degree from -150 to 150 increasing clockwise
  • callback – A function to be called at the end of the movement
Returns:

0 in case of success, raises an exception otherwise
cancel_callback()¶

Cancels the end move callback of the AX12

Returns:Returns nothing
turn(speed)¶

Orders the AX12 to turn at a constant speed

Parameters:speed – a percentage, positive for a clockwise speed
Returns:0 in case of success, raises an exception otherwise
